Cons1.summary: Initializes a new exception with the given message.
Cons1.param: A human-readable message that describes the error.

Cons2.summary: Initializes a new exception with the given message and inner exception.
Cons2.param: A human-readable message that describes the error.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

ConsBF.summary: Initializes a new operation failure exception with the given base message and failure reasons.

ConsF.summary: Initializes a new exception with the given failure reasons.
ConsF.param: A value that indicates potential causes for the failure.

ConsF2.summary: Initializes a new exception with the given failure reasons, and some additional error text.
ConsF2.param: A value that indicates potential causes for the failure.
Additional text to include in the error message.

Common.ToString: Converts the object to a human-readable string.

MakeReadOnly.summary: Validates and locks the property values of the object so that they cannot be changed. This method is intended to be called by the PGP interface before returning the object to the user.

Keyring.summary: Gets or sets the name of the keyring file that contains the key, or null if they key is from the default keyring.

KeyNotUpdatedImmediately.remarks: The changes to the key will not be be visible until the key is refreshed by retrieving it again from the PGP system.

AddDesignatedRevoker.summary: Adds a designated revoker to the given primary key. A designated revoker is a second key whose owner has the power to revoke the first key. A designated revoker cannot be removed once it has been added.
AddDesignatedRevoker.param: The key that can be revoked by the designated revoker. The secret portion of this key must be available.
The public key of the designated revoker.

AddPhoto3.summary: Adds the given image to the given key as a photo user id.
AddPhoto3.remarks: The default implementation simply saves the image as a JPEG and passes it to .

AddPhoto4.summary: Adds a photo in the given format to the given key.

AddUserId.summary: Adds a new user ID to the given primary key.

AddSubkey.summary: Adds a new subkey to the given primary key.

ChangeExpiration.summary: Changes the expiration time on a primary key or subkey.
ChangeExpiration.param: The key whose expiration time will be changed.
The new expiration time, or null if the key should not expire. The time must be in the future.

ChangePassword.summary: Changes the password on a primary key.

CleanKeys.summary: Cleans the given keys by removing unusable signatures and user IDs from them.

CreatePublicKeyring.summary: Creates a new, empty public keyring in the given file.
CreatePublicKeyring.remarks: The default implementation simply creates a zero-length file.

CreateSecretKeyring.summary: Creates a new, empty secret keyring in the given file.
CreateSecretKeyring.remarks: The default implementation simply creates a zero-length file.

CreateTrustDatabase.summary: Creates a new, empty trust database in the given file.
CreateTrustDatabase.remarks: The default implementation simply creates a zero-length file.

Decrypt.summary: Takes the given ciphertext or embedded signature and writes the original plaintext to the given destination. Embedded signatures are verified and returned. If you only want to embedded verify signatures in an encrypted, signed document, you can pass use a destination stream of .

DeleteAttributes.summary: Deletes the given attributes from their owning keys.

DeleteKeys.summary: Deletes the given primary keys, or a part of them, from their keyrings.
DeleteKeys.param: The portion of the keys to delete.

DeleteSignatures.summary: Deletes the given signatures from their owning attributes.

DeleteSubkeys.summary: Deletes the given subkeys from their owning keys.

DisableKeys.summary: Disables the given primary keys. Disabling a key is a local operation that does not change the key for any other user.

EnableKeys.summary: Enables the given primary keys. Enabling a key is a local operation that does not change the key for any other user.

Encrypt.summary: Encrypts the given source data, writing the result to the given destination.

ExportKeys.summary: Exports the given public keys to the given stream.

ExportKeys2.summary: Exports all keys in the given keyring files and/or the default keyring to the given stream.
ExportKeys2.param: Specifies a list of additional keyrings. If null or empty, no additional keyrings will be used.
Specifies whether the default keyring will be implicitly included. If false, only the keyrings listed in will be used.
The stream to which the key data will be written.
Options controlling how the keys should be exported.
Options that control the output format.

FindKeysOnServer.summary: Searches for keys on the given key server.
FindKeysOnServer.param: The key server that will be searched for keys.
A that controls the search and receives the search results.
An array of keywords that will be passed to the key server.
FindKeysOnServer.remarks: Many servers will return no results if the search is so general that too many results would be returned.

FindKey.summary: Searches for the public key with the given fingerprint, ID, or keyword in the given keyring.
FindKey.param: The fingerprint, ID, or keyword of the key to search for. Searching for fingerprints and key IDs works in an identical fashion across all PGP systems, but the exact level of support for keyword searching (ie, searching for names or email addresses) is not guaranteed.
The keyring to search, or null to search the default keyring.
Options controlling how keys should be returned.
FindKey.returns: Returns the key if it was found, or null if it was not found or was ambiguous.

FindKeys.summary: Searches for the public keys with the given fingerprints or IDs in the given keyrings.
FindKeys.param: An array containing the fingerprints or IDs of the keys to search for. A PGP implementation may allow searching for other types of key identifiers, such as email addresses, but that is not guaranteed, unless you use .
An array of additional keyrings to search, or null to use no additional keyrings.
If true, the default keyring will also be searched.
Options controlling how keys should be returned.
FindKeys.returns: Returns an array of primary keys with the same length as the array of fingerprints. The key at index i will have a fingerprint equal to fingerprintsOrIds[i], or will be null if no key with that fingerprint or ID was found.

GenerateRevocationCertificate.summary: Generates a revocation certificate for the given primary key. The revocation certificate can be imported at a later time to revoke the key. You must have the secret key.

GenerateRevocationCertificateD.summary: Generates a revocation certificate for the given key, using the given designated revoker key. You do not need the secret portion of the key to be revoked, but you need the secret portion of the designated revoker key and permission from the key to be revoked. The revocation certificate can be imported at a later time to revoke the key.

GetDefaultPrimaryKeyType.summary: Returns the type of key that will be created by default.

GetDefaultSubkeyType.summary: Returns the type of subkey that will be created by default.

GetPreferences.summary: Returns the preferences for the given user id or attribute.

GetRandomData.summary: Generates random data and writes it to the given buffer.
GetRandomData.param: The level of randomness of the data. For most operations, this should be .
The array to which the random data will be written.
The index within where writing will begin.
The number of bytes to write.

GetCardPin.summary: Gets the PIN or password for a smartcard.
GetCardPin.param: A string containing the type of the card.
A string containing the serial number of the card, if it's known.

GetDecryptionPassword.summary: Gets the password for a document encrypted with a password, or when requesting a new password for a key that doesn't have one yet.

GetKeyPassword.summary: Gets the password for the secret key named in the given password hint.
GetKeyPassword.param: The ID of the key whose password is sought.
A password hint to be displayed to the user, containing the user ID that owns the key and the key ID.
GetKeyPassword.returns: Returns a new containing the password.
GetKeyPassword.remarks: The password will be disposed after being used.

GetMaximumKeyLength.summary: Given a supported key type, returns the maximum supported key length.

GetKeys.summary: Gets all keys in the default keyring and/or the list of keyring files.
GetKeys.param: Specifies a list of additional keyring. If null or empty, no additional keyrings will be used.
Specifies whether the default keyring will be implicitly included. If false, only the keyrings listed in will be used.
Options controlling how keys should be returned.

GetSupportedCiphers.summary: Gets a list of the cipher algorithms supported by the PGP system. You can use them case-insensitively to check whether a given algorithm is supported.

GetSupportedCompressions.summary: Gets a list of the compression algorithms supported by the PGP system. You can use them case-insensitively to check whether a given algorithm is supported.

GetSupportedHashes.summary: Gets a list of the hash algorithms supported by the PGP system. You can use them case-insensitively to check whether a given algorithm is supported.

GetSupportedKeyTypes.summary: Gets a list of the key types supported by the PGP system. You can use them case-insensitively to check whether a given key type is supported.

Hash.summary: Generates a hash of the given data, using the given hash algorithm.
Hash.param: The name of the algorithm used to hash the data. This can be one of the values, or another algorithm name. If you don't particularly care which algorithm will be used, then it's usually best to use . If you do want to use a specific algorithm, you should check that it is supported by checking .
The stream from which the data to hash will be read.

ImportKeys2.summary: Imports keys from the given source into the default keyring.

ImportKeys3.summary: Imports keys from the given source into the given keyring.

ImportKeysFromServer.summary: Downloads the public keys specified with the given fingerprints (or key IDs) from the given key server, and imports them into the given keyring.

MinimizeKeys.summary: Minimizes the given keys by removing all signatures except the most recent self-signature, and removes unusable user IDs.

OnInvalidPassword.summary: Called when the password for the given key is invalid, to allow client applications to flush their password cache (if using one) and retry. Applications should not request a new password in response to this event.
OnInvalidPassword.param: The key ID whose password was invalid.

RefreshKeyringFromServer.summary: Refreshes all of the keys on the given keyring from a key server.
RefreshKeyringFromServer.param: Options that control the download, or null to use the default options. Note that using the default options will only succeed if all keys have preferred key servers set, which is probably not the case.
The keyring to refresh, or null to refresh the default keyring.

RefreshKeysFromServer.summary: Refreshes the given keys from a key server.
RefreshKeysFromServer.param: Options that control the download, or null to use the default options. Note that using the default options will only succeed if all keys have preferred key servers set, which is probably not the case.

RevokeAttributes.summary: Revokes the given attributes from their owning keys.

RevokeKeys.summary: Revokes the given primary keys if you have their secret keys. You will typically want to publish the revoked keys to a key server or otherwise distribute them afterwards so that other people will know the keys have been revoked.

RevokeKeysD.summary: Revokes the given primary keys using the given designated revoker key. You do not need the secret keys of the keys to be revoked, but you must have the secret key of the designated revoker key, and permission from the keys to be revoked. You will typically want to publish the revoked keys to a key server or otherwise distribute them afterwards so that other people will know the keys have been revoked.

RevokeSignatures.summary: Revokes the given signatures from their owning attributes.

RevokeSubkeys.summary: Revokes the given subkeys from their owning keys.

SetOwnerTrust.summary: Sets the owner trust level of the given keys, which indicates how much you trust the owner to rigorously validate the identities of the keys they sign.

SetPreferences.summary: Sets the preferences of the given user attribute.
SetPreferences.remarks: Note that if the property is set to false, it won't cause any change in the property of the user attribute. To make an attribute non-primary, set another attribute as primary.

Sign.summary: Signs the given source data and writes the result to the given destination.

SignAndEncrypt.summary: Signs and/or encrypts the given source data and writes the result to the given destination.
SignAndEncrypt.param: The stream from which the unencrypted source data will be read.
The stream to which the signed and/or encrypted data will be written.
Options that control the signing of the data, or null to only encrypt the data.
Options that control the encryption of the data, or null to only sign the data.
Options that control the output format.
SignAndEncrypt.remarks: Only one of and can be null.

SignAttribute.summary: Signs the given user ID or user attribute.

SignAttributes.summary: Signs the given user IDs or user attributes.

SignKey.summary: Signs the given key. This is equivalent to signing all user IDs on the key.

SignKeys.summary: Signs the given keys. This is equivalent to signing all user IDs on the keys.

UploadKeys.summary: Uploads the given keys to a key server.

Verify2.summary: Verifies embedded signatures in the given signed data. The signed data should not have been simultaneously encrypted. To verify signatures in encrypted, signed data, or to retrieve the original data from an embedded or cleartext signature, call .

Verify3.summary: Verifies detached signatures for the given signed data.
